title: Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Alabama top CFP ranking
content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: Jets GM thrilled for 'value' in 2 blockbuster deals
content: Jets GM Darren Mougey said the trades of defensive cornerstones Sauce Gardner and Quinnen Williams did not represent "a teardown," stating instead, "The goal is always to win."

title: Boozer takes over game after Scheyer's challenge
content: After failing to score in the first half, Duke freshman Cameron Boozer rallied to finish with 15 points and 13 rebounds -- 10 of those after halftime -- as the Blue Devils overcame a 33-32 halftime deficit to beat Texas in the Dick Vitale Invitational.

title: Venus to start 33rd pro season at Auckland event
content: Tennis great Venus Williams plans to play for a 33rd straight season on the WTA Tour, starting in Auckland in January as a hint that she is preparing for the Australian Open later that month.

title: Magic's Bane tossed after firing ball at Okongwu
content: Desmond Bane was ejected Tuesday after committing a hard foul on Onyeka Okongwu and firing the ball at the Hawks' center while he fell to the floor.

title: Red-hot Bulls rally from 24 down to topple 76ers
content: The Bulls stormed back from a 24-point deficit to beat the 76ers on a late go-ahead 3-pointer in a battle between the early leaders in the East.

title: Strong, Fudd lead new-look UConn over Louisville
content: Led by stars Sarah Strong and Azzi Fudd, defending champion and preseason No. 1 UConn picked up where it left off Tuesday against No. 20 Louisville, earning a 79-66 victory in the first women's Armed Forces Classic matchup.

title: Source: RHP Bieber staying with Blue Jays in '26
content: Pitcher Shane Bieber opted into his $16 million player option with the Blue Jays for the 2026 season, choosing to forgo free agency, according to multiple reports.

title: üí™ Latest NFL Power Rankings
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 10. Plus, we picked out a critical game remaining on the schedule for every team.

content: The 7-2 Colts are going all-in on a Super Bowl run, while trading the CB was just part of the Jets' busy day.

content: NBA insiders break down the most impactful player, rookie or coach and where all 30 teams stack up in this week's power rankings.

content: The NHL is back at the Games (Feb. 11-22). Here's a look at which players will make the cut for the big five.

title: How the high-contact, high-octane Blue Jays nearly took down a baseball superpower -- and how it could change MLB
content: Toronto almost dethroned the mighty Dodgers by prioritizing contact. Will other teams follow the model?

title: Early MLB offseason rumors and buzz: Which stars will get traded? Which teams will rule the winter?
content: Will Skubal be dealt? Who could sign Schwarber and Tucker? Here's what we're hearing as the 2025-26 hot stove ignites.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: 'Are you serious?': How the LSU band got a 66 year-old tuba player
content: This season hasn't gone according to plan for LSU, but one member of the school's band is living his dream.

title: USWNT big board: Girma, Rodman injuries cloud 2027 World Cup plans
content: If the 2027 World Cup started today, which players would be on the UWSNT roster? Jeff Kassouf takes a look at who is -- and who isn't -- going to make the cut.

title: Trade deadline buzz: How will Shaheed fit into Seahawks offense after trade?
content: Fantasy football impact of every NFL trade deadline deal, including Jakobi Meyers and Rashid Shaheed.

title: Liverpool-Real Madrid reaction: Reds' resurgence continues, Trent's unhappy return to Anfield, more
content: Liverpool turned in their best performance of the season vs. Real Madrid in the Champions League, as Trent Alexander-Arnold faced his old club for the first time.

title: The real Azzi Fudd?  'None of you have seen it'
content: The Most Outstanding Player of last year's Final Four has shown her peak powers only in small glimpses. Now Azzi Fudd is ready to level up for the Huskies' repeat bid.

title: Why the Cavaliers are doubling down despite two straight playoff disappointments
content: After two disappointing playoff exits, the Cavaliers aren't making any major changes to their schemes or plans. In fact, they're doubling down.

title: Pickups: Ryan Rollins, Quentin Grimes add instant offense
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid plot Vin√≠cius J√∫nior exit
content: Vin√≠cius J√∫nior's days at Real Madrid could be numbered. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bodies Of Newly-Married Couple Found In Jharkhand House, Probe Underway: Cops
content: Panic gripped the Belabagan Kalibari area of Deoghar on Wednesday afternoon after a young couple was found dead inside their rented accommodation under mysterious circumstances.

title: After Mamdani's NYC Win, Mumbai BJP Chief's 'No Khan Mayor Here' Comment
content: The mayoral election victory of Zohran Mamdani, 34 - the first South Asian, Muslim and youngest in a century to helm the administration of New York City - has an effect on the other side of the globe in Mumbai.

title: 9 'Pushpa' Smugglers Arrested, 20 Red Sanders Logs Seized In Tirupati
content: In an operation that points to the real-world battle against the illicit trade made famous by the blockbuster film Pushpa, the Red Sanders Anti-Smuggling Task Force (RSASTF) police seized 20 valuable red sanders logs

title: Delhi's Toxic Air Hides Another Health Crisis: 'Sunshine Vitamin' Deficiency
content: As air quality across Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR) worsens, a hidden health concern is emerging - a surge in vitamin D deficiency. With thick smog cutting off sunlight, doctors are now urging residents to take supplements.

title: Chinese Spaceship's Return Delayed Due To Suspected Debris Strike
content: A suspected strike by "tiny space debris" has delayed the return of the Chinese spaceship Shenzhou-20 and three astronauts, Beijing's space agency said on Wednesday.

title: IndiGo Says Delhi Flight Operations Hit After Air Traffic Congestion
content: IndiGo on Tuesday issued a travel advisory alerting passengers that flight operations from Delhi may be impacted due to air traffic congestion, leading to delays and extended wait times for passengers.

title: No Meetings, No Files, No Budget: Centre's HPV Vaccine Promise Gathers Dust
content: Nearly two years after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's Budget 2024 announcement to protect young girls from cervical cancer, the government's promise remains largely unfulfilled, an RTI reply has found.

title: UN Says Attack On Funeral In Key Sudan City Kills 40
content: An attack on a funeral in the key city of El-Obeid in Sudan's central Kordofan region killed 40 people, the UN said Wednesday, as paramilitaries looked poised to launch an offensive.

title: 43-Year-Old Woman, Grazing Goats In Field, Raped In Jharkhand: Cops
content: A man was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly raping a 43-year-old woman in Jharkhand's Palamu district, police said.

title: Man Rams Car Into Pedestrians, Cyclists In France, 10 Injured
content: A 35-year-old man Wednesday rammed his car into pedestrians and cyclists on the French Atlantic island of Oleron, wounding10 people, including four seriously, a prosecutor said.

title: Rs 14-Crore Cure For Daughter: How Self-Styled Godman Conned Pune Techie
content: A Pune-based IT engineer lost everything, including his life savings and his home abroad, after he was duped into believing that a godman's spirit living inside a woman could cure his seriously ill daughter.

title: This Volcano In Iran Was 'Sleeping' For 700,000 Years. It Might Be Waking Up
content: An Iranian volcano long thought extinct may be showing signs of activity after thousands of years. The Taftan volcano, located near the Iran-Pakistan border, was believed to have been dormant for roughly 7.1 lakh years.

title: Swiss Seek Cultural Heritage Recognition From United Nations For Yodelling
content: Yodel-ay-hee ... what?! Those famed yodeling calls that for centuries have echoed through the Alps, and more recently have morphed into popular song and folk music, could soon reap a response - from faraway Paris.

title: Former Karnataka Minister HY Meti Dies At 79
content: Karnataka Congress MLA from Bagalkote and former minister H Y Meti died at a private hospital here on Tuesday, party and hospital sources said.

title: "Got Our As*es Handed To Us": Vivek Ramaswamy On Zohran Mamdani's Victory
content: Republican leader Vivek Ramaswamy offered a candid message to Republicans after Democrats won in three key races in the US, including Zohran Mamdani's victory in New York City's mayoral election.

title: UP Woman Claims Rs 25 Lakh Insurance After Husband's Death, But He's Alive
content: A couple in Uttar Pradesh has been arrested for claiming insurance money worth Rs 25 lakh by issuing a fake death certificate to declare the husband dead.

title: Woman Pic In Rahul Gandhi's H-Bomb Clicked In 2017, Downloaded 4 Lakh Times
content: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's much-awaited 'Hydrogen bomb' press conference, in which he made serious allegations of irregularities in the Haryana Assembly polls last year, has brought a mystery woman under the spotlight.

title: Professor, Amanda And Abbas: Delhi's 'Money Heist' Gang Steals Rs 150 Crore
content: Inspired by the Netflix thriller Money Heist, a gang in Delhi stole Rs 150 crore through an elaborate plan. The gang members even named themselves after characters in the thriller. They also took another Rs 23 crore by duping people online.

title: Germany Bans Muslim Group Calling For Caliphate, Cracks Down On Others
content: The German government on Wednesday banned a Muslim group, accusing it of violating human rights and the country's democratic values, and conducted raids against two other Muslim groups across the country.

title: "Cry More, Racist Losers": Journalist Mehdi Hasan's Post After Zohran Mamdani's Victory
content: Journalist Mehdi Hasan couldn't resist trolling New York's critics following Zohran Mamdani's historic mayoral victory on Tuesday.

title: Telangana to build solar-powered car parking canopy at Secretariat for ‚Çπ17 crore
content: Secretariat complex includes parking for 650 cars and 500 two-wheelers; project is to be completed within six months from the start date

title: Many places in Andhra Pradesh receive moderate showers due to low pressure
content: Vijayawada records 40 mm rainfall in less than an hour; light to moderate showers, accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning, are likely at a few places on November 6 and 7 in South Coastal and Rayalaseema regions, says IMD

title: Fake passport scam: Enforcement Directorate probes into Bengal businessman's 900 trips to Bangkok
content: Several documents were seized during the raid, and officials claim to have found ‚Äúvital and suspicious‚Äù information, an official said

title: Maharashtra doctor‚Äôs death: Policeman held in the case sacked
content: ‚ÄúFollowing the instructions of Special IG Sunil Phulari, Gopal Badane has been dismissed from the service under section 311 (2)(b) of Indian Constitution, effective November 4,‚Äù said Satara SP Tushar Doshi

title: Chhattisgarh train collision: Crew failed to control passenger train at red signal, says initial probe report
content: The report said that the crew of train number 68733 was responsible for not controlling the train at the right time and in the right position before the danger signal and committing an Signal Passed at Danger violation

title: Division Bench restrains single judge from proceeding with Madras Race Club case
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq grant the interim stay following a petition filed by Tamil Nadu government

title: BSWML to give contract for end-to-end management of animal waste in Bengaluru
content: City produces an estimated 200 tonnes of animal waste each day, animal waste generators to pay a fee of ‚Çπ5 per kilo to BSWML under the new system

title: New facilities at government hospitals at Mattancherry and Fort Kochi
content: Newly constructed blocks at the Woman and Child Hospital in Mattancherry and the Fort Kochi Taluk Hospital, a renovated community hall at Kalvathy and beautification of Diamond Park among the joint initiatives of Kochi Corporation and Cochin Smart Mission Limited

title: Volunteers come forward to offer free meals to visitors at McGann hospital in Shivamogga
content: Former mayor Shankar and his friends began offering lunch every Sunday in 2024. The gesture received a good response. Gradually, other organizations joined the initiative

title: Elder brother of JD(U) leader, wife, daughter found dead at home in Bihar
content: The bodies were recovered from their house in the European colony under the Kehat Police Station limits on Tuesday night, a senior officer said.

title: Railways launch drive against footboard travel on trains
content: Move follows an incident in which a woman sustained critical injuries after being allegedly pushed off a moving train near Varkala

title: 65-year-old woman murdered at home in Bengaluru‚Äôs Uttarahalli
content: Police suspect that someone known to the family might have entered the house and strangled the victim before fleeing with her gold chain

title: Samridhi@Kochi opens outlet in Fort Kochi
content: The initiative‚Äôs flagship offering, meals priced at ‚Çπ20, will be available at the new outlet, with more items to be added to the menu gradually

title: TMC calls BJP 'anti-Bengal'; says none of its MP from State attended Chittaranjan Das tribute
content: "Question to BJP desperate to win votes in Bengal: why were BJP's Bengal MPs absent at the floral tributes ceremony for Deshbandhu Chittaranjan Das this morning in Parliament?" Sagarika Ghose said

title: Farmers‚Äô incomes increased significantly after joining Akshayakalpa Organic: CEO Shashi Kumar
content: Narratives of Indian farming will change¬†completely if more youngsters entered the field, Mr. Kumar said

title: Ferry-based coastal tourism corridor linking Nagapattinam and Mayiladuthurai is on cards in Tamil Nadu
content: The proposed corridor would link several spiritual, ecological, and heritage destinations in a single travel circuit.

title: NISAR to be declared operational on November 7: ISRO chief
content: The ISRO chief also said the first uncrewed mission of the Gaganyaan project ‚Äî India's human spaceflight programme ‚Äî is expected to take place in January 2026

title: Mysuru MP opposes flyovers on Vinoba Road, J.L.B. Road
content: The plans appear unjustified with no studies and public consultations, says Yaduveer Krishnadatta Chamaraja Wadiyar

title: Former LDF Minister T.U. Kuruvilla slams Kerala govt for delay in Chelad stadium completion
content: He says Chelad stadium could have been ‚Äòcompleted long ago if even less than half of the ‚Çπ70 crore reportedly being spent on renovating Kaloor international stadium was invested‚Äô in proposed project

title: Rahul's Haryana vote theft claim 'baseless', attempt to defame country: BJP
content: Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Kiren Rijiju accused Rahul Gandhi of "playing games" in collusion with "anti-India" forces to defame the country.

title: Agri tech is a ‚Äòbig part‚Äô of FTA negotiations with India, says New Zealand Trade Minister McClay
content: New Zealand‚Äôs Trade Minister Todd McClay stressed the importance of agricultural tech in FTA talks with India, aiming to boost farmers‚Äô incomes and strengthen economic ties during negotiations in Auckland

title: TVK chief Vijay hits out at CM Stalin over Assembly remarks on Karur stampede
content: The party‚Äôs general council also passed a resolution that it would contest the elections under Mr. Vijay‚Äôs leadership and authorised him to take decisions regarding alliances

title: Fadnavis busy in Bihar, leaving Maharashtra farmers in lurch: Uddhav
content: People should unite and teach a lesson to the current government. I am here with you people, and the CM is in Bihar. Farmers are in trouble here. But leaving farmers in this situation, he is going around in Bihar, says

title: Women workers at TATA Electronics protest after camera found in hostel bathroom in Hosur
content: Late Tuesday evening, hundreds of women workers staged a sit-in outside Vidiyal Residency, demanding that all bathrooms be searched for cameras

title: Rahul Gandhi trying to create anarchy by demanding reservations in defence forces, alleges Rajnath
content: The BJP leader also claimed that Rahul Gandhi should know that "running the country is not a game for children"

title: Why did Congress not flag flaws earlier: ECI on Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs claim on Haryana vote fudging
content: Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs claims of vote rigging in Haryana elections were dismissed by the Election Commission, noting no appeals were filed, raising questions about the validity of his allegations

title: Air India ferries 228 passengers stranded in Mongolia‚Äôs Ulaanbaatar to Delhi
content: The passengers were stranded in the Mongolian capital after their San Francisco-Delhi flight was diverted to Ulaanbaatar

title: Punjab Congress chief Warring booked over 'casteist' remarks on Buta Singh
content: Mr. Warring, the Punjab Congress chief tendered an "unconditional apology" and said that Buta Singh, a veteran leader of his party, was like a father figure to him

title: Rahul Gandhi drops ‚ÄòH files‚Äô to allege BJP ‚Äòstole‚Äô 2024 Haryana Assembly polls with ECI‚Äôs help
content: Congress leader claims that the photograph of a Brazilian model was used for 22 voters with different names across 10 booths of the Rai Assembly seat

title: NYC mayoral election an ‚Äúinternal matter‚Äù of United States: official sources on Zohran Mamdani‚Äôs victory
content: The Hindu was told that Mamdani‚Äôs mention of the Indian leadership and developments in India on the campaign trail were viewed as a ‚Äúdesperate attempt‚Äù to polarise the Indian diaspora voters

title: Seven arrested for attacking PMK MLA Arul‚Äôs supporters in Salem; Anbumani‚Äôs camp stages protest
content: Claiming that no case had been registered against the supporters of Mr. Arul for allegedly attacking Mr. Anbumani‚Äôs supporters, PMK cadre staged a sit-in protest

title: EESL to set up India‚Äôs largest geothermal energy technology pilot project in Andhra Pradesh
content: ‚ÄúEESL will set up two installations in Araku Valley and Visakhapatnam as a part of it,‚Äù according to an official release

title: Tech has transformed public buses, but some routes still see run-down service: SC
content: The Court noted that STCs were inconsistent with their service improvements, observing that ‚Äúin certain areas/routes old buses which are on the verge of being phased out are being plied‚Äù

title: 'Acting superior': Indian man assaulted in Canada; video sparks outrage
content: A disturbing video from Toronto shows an alleged drunk man assaulting an Indian individual in a cafe, sparking outrage and renewed fears of xenophobia. This unprovoked attack, where the aggressor hurled insults, follows a recent fatal assault on an Indian-origin businessman in Edmonton. Both incidents highlight growing concerns over immigrant safety and racially motivated violence across Canada.

title: Pant returns! India name Test squad for South Africa series
content: Rishabh Pant returned to India's Test squad for the series against South Africa starting in Kolkata, replacing N Jagadeesan. Pant proved his fitness with a strong performance for India A against South Africa A in the warm-up fixture. Key players will join the Test squad after the Australia T20Is, while Kuldeep Yadav gets early preparation time in Bengaluru.

title: Muslim, socialist & more: 5 reasons why Trump's Maga hates NYC Mayor Mamdani
content: New York has elected Zohran Mamdani, a Muslim, African-born democratic socialist, as its youngest mayor in over a century. His victory, celebrated by progressives, is seen as a significant challenge to MAGA ideology, embodying cultural shifts and progressive policies that alarm Donald Trump and his supporters.

title: Awkward! Tejashwi-Tej encounter at Patna airport goes viral - watch
content: Estranged brothers Tejashwi and Tej Pratap Yadav had an unexpected airport encounter ahead of Bihar's assembly elections. While Tejashwi greeted YouTuber Samdish, Tej Pratap watched silently, later stating he was "doing fine" when asked about their strained relationship. The viral clip highlights the political and personal rift within the family.

title: Tech layoffs: IBM to cut thousands of jobs; here‚Äôs what the company said
content: IBM is set to lay off a small percentage of its global workforce in late 2025, impacting thousands as it pivots towards high-margin AI and software services. This strategic shift, under CEO Arvind Krishna, follows earlier cuts in marketing and HR, with hiring now focused on sales and software development.

title: 'A benchmark': Watchdog FATF hails ED; lauds agency's asset recovery efforts
content: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF) acknowledged India's success in recovering public assets lost to financial crimes. A notable case highlighted involves land confiscated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) being identified for a new public airport, demonstrating effective asset recovery and societal benefit.

title: Travelling alone on shoestring budget: Making of India's 90th GM Ilamparthy
content: Thirteen-year-old Ilamparthi, initially an uninvited guest at a chess camp, has now become India's 90th Grandmaster. Guided by GM Shyam Sundar Mohanraj, his journey, despite financial hardships and family challenges, is marked by exceptional talent and unwavering discipline. The young prodigy's dedication promises a bright future in the chess world.

title: Platform friction: Amazon warns Perplexity over its Comet browser; asks to stop bots
content: Amazon has issued a cease-and-desist to Perplexity AI over its Comet browser agent making purchases. Amazon alleges fraud and terms violations, claiming Comet degrades the shopping experience and creates privacy risks. Perplexity counters, accusing Amazon of anti-competitive behavior and protecting its ad revenue, marking a significant clash over autonomous AI agents.

title: From Brazilian model to Saddam Hussain ‚Äî What Rahul alleged in 'H-files' presser
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission and BJP of a conspiracy to manipulate Haryana's election results, alleging 25 lakh duplicate, non-existent, or manipulated voters. He presented evidence of "vote chori" across five categories, including a Brazilian model voting multiple times under different names. Gandhi claimed the EC refused to use its software to detect discrepancies, suggesting complicity with the BJP.

title: From quoting Nehru to playing ‚ÄòDhoom Machale‚Äô: How Mamdani channelled his inner Indian
content: Zohran Mamdani celebrated his historic New York City mayoral victory with a vibrant rally, quoting Jawaharlal Nehru and promising ambitious plans to tackle the cost-of-living crisis. His win marks him as the city's first Muslim mayor, first of South Asian heritage, and youngest in over a century, embodying a message of hope.

title: Stralink debuts in India: Maharashtra becomes first state to ink deal; to boost rural connectivity
content: Maharashtra has become the first Indian state to partner with Elon Musk's Starlink for satellite internet services. This collaboration aims to bring high-speed internet to rural and remote regions. The initiative will deploy satellite internet in government institutions and underserved districts. Starlink's entry into India is set for a commercial launch by early 2026.

title: After $12.6 billion Amazon stake cut, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes one of her biggest donations
content: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University a remarkable $80 million, one of its largest donations ever, bolstering diversity and equity initiatives. This substantial, unrestricted contribution will aid student aid, infrastructure, and operations, arriving at a crucial time for the institution. Scott's ongoing philanthropic spree includes significant gifts to other DEI causes and a reduction in her Amazon holdings.

title: Trapped in gridlock, helpless father walks with sick child in arms
content: A father carried his sick daughter through heavy traffic in Uttar Pradesh after their ambulance became stuck. The heartwarming video shows the man navigating congested roads, sparking outrage over emergency response and traffic management. Social media users demand immediate action to improve traffic flow and prioritize emergency vehicles. The incident highlights critical challenges faced by citizens during emergencies.

title: 'Why his atom bomb never explodes?' BJP slams Rahul's 'H-files' expose - watch
content: Union minister Kiren Rijiju has dismissed Rahul Gandhi's "vote chori" allegations regarding the Haryana polls, questioning the Congress leader's repeated claims. Rijiju highlighted internal dissent within the Haryana Congress, with party leaders admitting to poor performance due to infighting, making Gandhi's accusations unbelievable.

title: Sense of humour, knowledge of MS Office - requirements of becoming Afghan cricket coach
content: The Afghanistan Cricket Board is seeking a new head coach, listing sense of humour and proficiency in Microsoft Office as key requirements. This comes as current coach Jonathan Trott expressed frustration over a lack of input in squad selection and communication with ACB management.  The board's unusual job descriptions have drawn public reaction.

title: Jaipur highway horror revisited: Dumper driver admits drinking twice
content: A dumper driver, Kalyan Meena, arrested for mowing down 17 vehicles and killing 13 in Jaipur, was reportedly drunk. Police confirmed 13 fatalities after initial confusion. Authorities are reviewing traffic management, vowing a crackdown on drunk driving and encroachments. The driver's license is being permanently revoked.

title: Air purifiers giving reality check to Delhi's AQI? Netizens take to social media; point at difference in reading
content: Delhi-NCR faces severe air pollution. Air purifiers reveal alarming filter conditions, indicating dangerous air quality. Netizens share stark differences between official AQI data and their devices. Even iconic landmarks like India Gate are obscured by smog. Regions like Noida and Gurgaon also experience high pollution. Authorities implement measures, but experts warn of chronic issues.

title: Vedant Birla‚ÄìTejal Kulkarni wedding: Urvashi Rautela & celebs bless newlyweds
content: Vedant Birla, son of industrialist Yashovardhan (Yash) Birla and Avanti Birla, tied the knot with Tejal Kulkarni, daughter of Sanjeev and Supriya Kulkarni, on November 2 in an intimate ceremony attended by close family members and friends.The couple later hosted a lavish wedding reception which saw the presence of several Bollywood celebrities, industrialists, and politicians who came together to bless the couple.

title: Chucarosaurus diripienda: Giant dinosaur that shattered roads & redefined titanosaurs
content: A colossal titanosaur, Chucarosaurus diripienda, unearthed in Patagonia, measured 30 meters and weighed tens of tonnes. Its immense size even cracked a road during transport, highlighting its incredible bulk. This discovery offers new insights into how these giants evolved, moved, and survived, challenging previous notions of their agility and strength.

title: 'Don't drag Army into politics': Rajnath flays Rahul; row erupts over '10%' remark
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh criticised Rahul Gandhi for his remarks on the Army, accusing him of attempting to politicise the armed forces and create anarchy. Singh emphasised that soldiers follow 'Sainya Dharma' above all divisions, refuting Gandhi's claim that the top 10% control the Army and that 90% from backward communities are excluded from power.

title: Andhra ashram school headmistress suspended for making students massage her legs
content: An in-charge headmistress at a tribal ashram school in Andhra Pradesh was suspended after a video surfaced showing students massaging her legs. The incident, which occurred about 10 days prior, sparked outrage and led to immediate action by authorities. A senior lawyer condemned the act as misconduct and exploitation of children.

title: 'Why are you silent?' Priyanka urges voters to kick out NDA govt; backs Rahul's 'H-files'
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra strongly backed Rahul Gandhi's "vote theft" claims in Haryana, urging citizens to recognize their power and remove the ruling government. She accused the NDA of destroying everything and called for action against alleged election manipulation. Rahul Gandhi presented "H-Files," alleging widespread irregularities and a compromised election commission, warning of destroyed democratic foundations.

title: 'Why no Congress agents raised objection?' EC questions Rahul's allegations
content: Rahul Gandhi alleged a massive vote theft in Haryana, claiming 25 lakh fake voters and questioning the Election Commission. The EC countered, asking why Congress booth agents didn't raise objections during electoral roll revisions. Gandhi presented evidence of duplicate voters and a "Brazilian model" appearing multiple times on the list.

title: Trump sanctions bite! Oil to India, China fall steeply; but can world ignore Russian crude?
content: New US sanctions on Russian crude oil firms are causing major purchasers in China, India, and Turkey to distance themselves, leading to a significant decline in seaborne exports. Refiners are hesitant to accept Russian crude, resulting in increased oil volumes idling at sea and a drop in Moscow's oil revenue.

title: 'There is a bigger picture': Morne Morkel reveals why India rested Arshdeep Singh
content: Bowling coach Morne Morkel explained Arshdeep Singh's rest in the T20I series against Australia was for experimenting with bowling combinations ahead of the T20 World Cup. Arshdeep returned strongly, earning Player of the Match. Meanwhile, Nitish Kumar Reddy was ruled out due to ongoing fitness concerns.

title: Piyush Goyal gives update on India-US trade talks; cites 'sensitive issues'
content: India and the US are making progress on trade talks, with Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal stating discussions on a Bilateral Trade Agreement are "going on very well." Despite positive developments, sensitive issues remain, requiring additional time. Both nations are working towards a mutually advantageous agreement, aiming to significantly increase trade volumes.

title: UP railway station tragedy: Devotees took shortcut to cross tracks
content: Six devotees were killed and several others critically injured after being run over by the Kalka-bound Netaji Express at Chunar railway station. The pilgrims attempted to cross the tracks instead of using the foot overbridge, leading to the tragic accident. Relief and rescue operations are underway, with authorities investigating the incident.

title: It can be very expensive: Indian student in NYC shares experience
content: Indian students are increasingly drawn to New York City for creative studies, with Parsons student Anishka Tewari highlighting the city as a dynamic classroom. While facing challenges like high costs and homesickness, students gain invaluable real-world experience, learn from diverse global perspectives, and develop strong personal resilience, making the demanding journey a significant life lesson beyond design.

title: Cardiac surgeon lists 5 everyday routines to boost longevity and safeguard heart
content: Dr Jeremy London, a cardiothoracic surgeon, reveals five daily habits for a longer life. These include regular exercise, a nutritious diet, sufficient rest, strong relationships, and heat therapy. These practices boost heart health, reduce disease risk, and improve overall well-being. Consistency in these habits is key to a healthier, longer life.

title: Tamannaah Bhatia stuns in Rs 66,300 bustier midi dress; edgy chic outfit perfect for dinner date
content: Marking another such moment of effortless chicness, the actress recently sported a luxurious midi dress that bore a notable price tag of Rs.66,300. Tamannaah dropped this appearance at the launch of a perfume line, endorsed by Samantha Ruth Prabhu, in the city. Read on to learn more about this look right here.

title: ‚ÄòWe trusted his mother‚Äôs word‚Äô: Faridabad girl‚Äôs stalker shot her days after apologising
content: Police in Faridabad are on the hunt for a 30-year-old man named Jatin Mangla, accused of shooting a 17-year-old student in Ballabgarh. The troubling case unfolded over several months with reports of stalking and harassment towards the victim. Despite attempts at reconciliation by the girl‚Äôs family, Mangla's violent actions escalated, leading to a confrontation that resulted in gunfire.

title: 'Forever etched in my skin': Harmanpreet gets inked after India win - unveils tattoo
content: Indian captain Harmanpreet Kaur celebrated the historic ICC Women's World Cup 2025 triumph with a special tattoo. The ink features the trophy, the year 2025, and the 52-run victory margin against South Africa. Kaur, who fulfilled a childhood dream, shared her emotional journey and encouraged aspiring cricketers to never stop dreaming.

title: Watch: Zohran Mamdani ends speech with Dhoom Machale track
content: New York City has elected Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old leftist and the city's first Muslim mayor. His victory speech, referencing Jawaharlal Nehru and concluding with the Bollywood hit "Dhoom Machale," resonated with supporters and sparked widespread online amusement. Mamdani, who faced significant opposition, vowed to make the city a beacon of hope and a place for working people.

title: Delhi pollution: AQI remains in 'poor' category
content: Delhi's air quality saw a slight improvement on Wednesday, with the AQI at 228, still in the 'poor' category. Authorities have issued over 20,000 challans under GRAP-2 since October 19, 2025, targeting polluting vehicles. Commercial vehicles not registered in Delhi and below BS-3 standards are being turned back. Water sprinkling operations are underway to combat pollution.

title: 'I want India's GenZ to understand ... ': Rahul accuses EC, BJP of vote theft in Haryana
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the BJP of "stealing" the Haryana Assembly election mandate, alleging a deliberate plan to convert Congress victories into BJP wins. He cited numerous complaints from candidates about vote count irregularities and announced the compilation of "H Files" detailing the alleged manipulation, criticizing the Election Commission for subverting the democratic process.

title: 'A moment comes in history ... ': Zohran Mamdani invokes Nehru in victory speech ‚Äî Watch
content: New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, invoked India's first Prime Minister Nehru in his victory speech, declaring a "mandate for change." The 34-year-old, the city's youngest and first Muslim mayor, vowed to show the nation how to defeat Donald Trump. Mamdani's win, against formidable opponents, marks a significant shift in the city's political landscape.

title: 'Who is this woman?' Rahul says Brazilian model voted 22 times in Haryana
content: Rahul Gandhi ignited a political storm, alleging widespread voter fraud in Haryana. He presented evidence suggesting approximately 25 lakh voters are fake, duplicate, or manipulated.  Gandhi highlighted a striking example: a single photograph appearing multiple times with different names and details, claiming it belonged to a 'Brazilian model' used as a stock image for fraudulent entries. This accusation comes just before the Bihar polls.

title: 'Countdown to November Revolution': Karnataka BJP trolls Congress over CM post
content: The BJP is mocking the Congress party over the Karnataka chief minister's post.  Speculation about a leadership change is ongoing.  The BJP released a spoof video on X.  It shows a game of musical chairs with Congress leaders.  The video is titled 'November Revolution'.  The BJP calls it a power struggle disguised as governance.

title: 'So hear me, president ...': Mamdani's 'four words' message to Trump
content: New York has elected its first Muslim mayor, Zohran Mamdani, who immediately challenged Donald Trump, vowing to fight hate and inequality. Mamdani pledged reforms against 'bad landlords,' a citywide rent freeze, and expanded labor protections, emphasizing economic justice. He also celebrated New York as a city of immigrants, directly confronting Trump's policies and asserting the city's inclusive identity.

title: Hidden health risks and side effects of chai and toast explained
content: Your beloved morning chai and toast might be silently impacting your health. Research indicates that daily consumption of refined carbs and sugary drinks can increase the risk of insulin resistance and metabolic syndrome. Simple swaps to whole grains, reduced sugar, and healthier toppings can transform this comfort food into a nourishing start.

title: Bihar: JD(U) leader Neeranjan Kushwaha‚Äôs brother, wife, daughter found dead
content: The elder brother of a JD(U) leader, his wife, and daughter were discovered deceased in their Purnea residence. Police recovered the bodies on Tuesday night and have sent them for post-mortem examinations. An investigation is underway to determine the cause of death, with forensic experts collecting evidence from the scene.

title: Sneako hails Zohran Mamdani‚Äôs ‚Äúgreatest campaign since Trump,‚Äù slams Elon Musk
content: Internet personality Sneako praised Zohran Mamdani's mayoral campaign, calling it the greatest since Donald Trump's and highlighting Mamdani's ability to "own the internet." Sneako also criticized Elon Musk for weighing in on the New York City election, questioning his ties to the city and suggesting his comments might be motivated by Mamdani's Muslim faith.

title: 12 States to spend ‚Çπ1.68 lakh crore on women's cash schemes: report
content: Twelve Indian States plan to allocate ‚Çπ1.68 lakh crore for women‚Äôs cash transfer schemes by 2025-26, reflecting a significant increase amid fiscal pressures and growing welfare expenditures

title: Watch: Mamata Banerjee warns BJP will fall if a voter is removed under SIR 2.0
content: Leading a protest march in Kolkata, she accused the BJP and the Election Commission of using the revision drive as a political tool to intimidate voters and manipulate the rolls.

title: Boats and coracles to be procured for flood rescue in Tamil Nadu
content: Nearly 200 coracles, each costing ‚Çπ13,000, are to be acquired for areas where waterlogging is not expected to be too deep

title: Watch: Death toll rises to 11 in Chhattisgarh train crash near Bilaspur
content: The MEMU passenger train had crashed into a stationary goods train on November 4, leaving 20 others injured. A detailed investigation is underway as authorities announce compensation for the victims and their families.

title: Suresh Gopi tells Kerala govt not to exaggerate extreme poverty eradication claims as ‚Äòploy to mislead people for another five years‚Äô
content: However, Union Minister says he will have no objection if State government‚Äôs claims are indeed factual

title: Matheran's popular toy train to roll again from November 6
content: As a precautionary measure for the monsoon season, the train services between Neral and Matheran were suspended from June to October

title: Monorail train tilts in Mumbai during test run; no passengers inside
content: A monorail train tilting during a test run in Mumbai‚Äôs Wadala depot on November 5 morning raises concerns amid ongoing technical issues in the suspended service

title: Rahul Gandhi ‚Äòrevelation‚Äô on voter theft highlights: Voter fraud being centrally carried out, Rahul Gandhi claims massive rigging in Haryana Assembly¬†elections
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi claims that there was no election in Haryana, there was a 'theft' in the State, and it is very clear who did it.

title: NCB arrests absconding suspect in 2010 drug trafficking case
content: The agency had seized 976 g of heroin at a private bus terminus in Koyambedu, Chennai, in November 2010. Three suspects¬†were arrested, while Ravi remained absconding in the case

title: Six women killed while crossing track at Chunar railway station in Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs Mirzapur
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath expressed grief over the incident and directed district officials to expedite relief measures

title: Special Intensive Revision: District Collectors in Kerala directed to avoid overlap of SIR and local body election works
content: Personnel engaged in conduct of local body elections will not be entrusted with BLO duties during SIR. In instances where staff involved in local body election work are also designated as BLO, they will be replaced by other officials, says Chief Electoral Officer (Kerala) Rathan Kelkar

title: FTA talks: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal visits New Zealand to review progress
content: ‚ÄúThe two countries will look forward to expediting the process for a comprehensive, mutually beneficial economic partnership,‚Äù Union Minister Piyush Goyal said

title: Encounter breaks out between security forces, terrorists in J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar
content: According to officials, the encounter began after the Jammu and Kashmir Police, assisted by the Indian Army and the CRPF, launched a joint operation in the Chhatru area

title: MARBH grants conditional permission to restore seats in BHMS, MD in Rajamahendravaram‚Äôs Homeopathic Medical College
content: The college is being allowed to take admission into 23 MD seats and an additional 13 seats in BHMS from the academic year 2025-26

title: Blue Futures exhibition at Hampi Art Labs reimagines legacy of indigo
content: Archival material, sound, and contemporary visuals together map indigo‚Äôs evolution across India, West Africa and Japan to modern design studios around the world

title: Nara Bhuvaneswari honoured with two prestigious awards in London
content: Nara Bhuvaneswari was conferred with the ‚ÄòDistinguished Fellowship 2025 Award‚Äô for her exceptional contributions to public service and social impact through the NTR Memorial Trust

title: Chhattisgarh train accident: Death toll rises to 11
content: The impact of the collision was so severe that a coach of the passenger train ended up on top of a wagon of the cargo train

title: Why Chennai‚Äôs Victoria Public Hall deserves to be restored
content: Despite questions about the money being spent on its restoration, the city‚Äôs hall deserves this work. Some symbols must be preserved, and this is one of them.

title: Bihar Assembly polls LIVE: NDA is going to form government with two-thirds majority, says Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh says, "There is a clear wave in favour of the NDA ahead of the first phase of voting. We will form the next government with a two-thirds majority,".

title: U.P. Factories (Amendment) Act enforced; allows govt to extend max daily working hours to 12
content: Under the new provisions, the State government is empowered to extend the maximum daily working hours in factories to 12 hours, provided that the total weekly working hours do not exceed 48

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs ‚Äòencounters‚Äô with artificial rain-making over the last 50 years
content: In 1993, when Chennai was gripped by yet another spell of water shortage, the trials were done. But, by then, a consensus had emerged among the scientific community that no area got any more than 20% of rainfall over and above normal

title: Post Op Sindoor, more lessons learned, need to be incorporated into model: CDS on theaterisation
content: Gen Anil Chauhan also spoke of the role of the CDS, and recalled that the top post does not have an operational mandate

title: House panel directs APMSIDC to submit audit reports
content: PSUs must function with transparency and accountability, ensuring timely completion of audits every financial year, says Chairman of Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly‚Äôs Public Undertakings Committee Koona Ravi Kumar

title: When Jayalalithaa proposed chemical castration for rapists
content: The alleged gang rape of a 20-year-old college student two days ago in Coimbatore has once again prompted discussions on severe punishment for sexual assault. Way back in 2013, then Tamil Nadu Chief Minister J. Jayalalithaa advocated chemical castration for rapists and the then DMK president Karunanidhi batted for solitary life imprisonment.

title: UPSC maintains status quo on appointing T.N. DGP
content: According to official sources, the UPSC has written back to the Tamil Nadu government reiterating its decision on the panel of DGP candidates fit for appointment as DGP/HoPF.

title: Five persons held in Vellore for stealing two-wheelers
content: Three persons were lodged at Central Prison in Vellore. Two juveniles were sent to the government home.

title: Be a brand ambassador for Dravidian model of governance: Udhayanidhi Stalin
content: Mr. Udhayanidhi inaugurated 31 completed works including a new sub-registrar building in Gudiyatham, additional classrooms, and anganwadi centres to a tune of ‚Çπ 11.80 crore

title: Punch-marked gold coins dating back to Vijayanagara-era unearthed in Tiruvannamalai
content: Officials of HR&CE, which was involved in restoration of the ancient temple at a cost of ‚Çπ 2.5 crore, said that a group of workers were digging a trench in the sanctum sanctorum when they hit a small pot.

title: Part of 75-year-old overbridge collapses in M.P.‚Äôs Indore; municipal corporation blames rats
content: Officials said the repair work is being carried out according to standards of the Indian Roads Congress (IRC) and based on recommendations of civil engineering experts

title: HC directs Collector‚Äôs panel to oversee canal and drainage systems in Kochi
content: The committee should ensure completion of construction of Mullassery Canal under Operation Breakthrough Phase ‚Äì III and that of culverts by Railways, says court

title: Kochi Mayor adjourns council meeting after declaring passage of agenda
content: The meeting, potentially the final one of the current term of the Corporation, lasted just 30 minutes; Opposition UDF protests against the ‚Äòabrupt dismissal‚Äô of the meeting without discussion

title: Kochi to be turned into a beautified, litter-free city
content: The urban beautification project aims to establish a permanent mechanism for maintaining clean pavements and adjoining areas, besides sprucing up medians and compound walls of nearby establishments by planting flowering plants

title: 17-year-old girl shot at by stalker in Haryana‚Äôs Faridabad, hunt on for accused
content: The main accused ‚Äî seen waiting for her in the street in CCTV footage, walking up to her and then shooting her at point-blank range ‚Äî has been identified as 20-year-old Jatin Mangla, who worked as an accountant, from Sarmathla village near Sohna in Gurugram

title: Maharashtra cabinet approves 21 key decisions in one go ahead of local body elections
content: The cabinet chaired by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis also made some significant changes in policies for farmers, labourers, healthcare workers, and the judicial workforce, holding administrative and socio-economic significance

title: Case booked against government school teacher who beat up student in Puzhuthivakkam
content: The Tamil Nadu State Commission for Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes calls for a report from the police over a complaint that relevant Sections of the Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989 had not been invoked in the complaint

title: Bombay HC grants bail to 2011 Mumbai triple blast accused after 13 years
content: The Bombay High Court cited constitutional right to speedy trial and said that prolonged incarceration cannot justify indefinite detention.

title: Madras High Court pulls up Chennai cybercrime police for freezing bank account of publicly listed company
content: Justice M. Nirmal Kumar says, non adherence to a 2021 circular issued by Greater Chennai Commissioner of Police cannot be taken lightly

title: Bihar‚Äôs electoral battles should be about land, not caste alone
content: Decades of ‚Äúsocial justice‚Äù politics have brought backward castes to power. But the wealth remains with a tiny forward caste elite. Why won‚Äôt anyone talk about redistribution?

title: NGO begins campaign in Karnataka to display Constitution‚Äôs Preamble in private institutions
content: To spread awareness about the Constitution, the Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Organisation, a non-government organisation, has launched a Statewide campaign to display the Preamble of the Constitution in the offices of cooperative societies, milk federations, private banks, and educational institutions across the State

title: In attack and defense, Bayern Munich show why they're Champions League favorites
content: Bayern Munich beat PSG 2-1 in adversity in the Parc des Princes . the UEFA champions are the team to beat on the road to next may's final in Budapest . it's time to take Bayern Munich seriously as potential winners . click here for all the latest bayern munich news .

title: Week 11 Anger Index: The case for outrage over BYU's and Miami's CFP rankings
content: the college football playoff committee has released its first top 25 ranking of the year . it's the sport's version of Walmart opening its doors at midnight on black Friday . this year, the committee has said it is considering a new "record strength" metric .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Where do things stand following the first committee ranking?
content: the lone ACC team in the bracket if it were released today would be no. 14 Virginia . the ACC is already playing from behind, and it's only the first ranking of the season . teams with Would be in status below are in this week's bracket based on the committee ranking .

title: Free agent pickups: Loveland among trio of TEs worth adding
content: the ninth Sunday of the season featured a wild, defenseless slugfest in Buffalo . preseason top tight end Brock Bowers scored three touchdowns and a league-high 43.3 PPR points . cam Little blasted the longest field goal in NFL history .

title: Man, waiting on road after van breaks down, killed by truck in Bengaluru
content:
Bengaluru: A 35-year-old dance instructor, who participated in TV reality shows and ran a dance school, was killed after he was knocked down by a speeding truck on Tumakuru Road near Pemmanahalli village Tuesday. The deceased, Sudheendra, had gone to his elder brother's house Monday evening after he purchased a Maruti Suzuki Eeco minivan. He stayed overnight with his brother and was on his way back home Tuesday. Dobbespet police said Sudheendra's new vehicle broke down near Pemmanahalli village on the highway at 7.15am. With the help of commuters, he pushed the van to the extreme left of the road and called his brother. But a speeding truck hit Sudheendra and the van. CCTV footage shows the truck was in the middle lane, but the driver lost control and drove to the extreme left and hit Sudheendra and the van. The truck driver, Pitha Kumar, 22, from Tamil Nadu, has been arrested.

End of Article
